cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / below Tropical-Storm strength
cyclone.current_location: about 480 mi ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing quickly west toward the south-central Texas coast, then inland across south Texas Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast between Baffin Bay and Port O'Connor (near/just north of Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port O'Connor to Sargent, Texas (tropical-storm watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas (tropical-storm warning area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas shoreline from the Mouth of the Rio Grande northward through Baffin Bay, Corpus Christi Bay, and Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Fringe gusts 20–30 mph possible Tuesday as outer bands pass well south of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rise (<1 ft) possible; main 1–3 ft surge forecast stays south of Sargent
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent bands Tuesday–Wednesday could create brief ponding in low-lying terminal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along upper Texas coast may impede pilot boarding and small-craft movements
